verses.roman:
prasāda pāi anyonye kailā āliṅgana
caitanya-virahe duṅhe karilā krandana

synonyms: prasāda pāi—after eating the remnants of food; anyonye—one another; kailā āliṅgana—they embraced; caitanya-virahe—in separation from Lord Caitanya; duṅhe—both; karilā krandana—cried.
translation: After eating the prasāda, they embraced each other and cried due to separation from Lord Caitanya.
